channel.title: New iPod Nano
channel.description:
[img]http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2010/09/01/article-0-0B00E9E5000005DC-607_468x286.jpg[/img]
Apple is to launch a new touchscreen version of the iPod nano which is almost half as small as the current version. The new device is 42 per cent lighter than the existing Nano and no longer has the familiar touchwheel for moving between tracks. The new device was part of an overhaul of the entire iPod range unveiled by Apple boss Steve Jobs this evening. Dressed in his traditional uniform of black top and jeans, Jobs said: 'We've gone wild. It's the biggest change in the iPod lineup ever.' Read more: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-1308113/Apple-music-event-Steve-Jobs-unveils-touchscreen-iPod-Nano-new-iPod-Touch.html?ito=feeds-newsxml#ixzz0yIlj5rE4
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-1308113/Apple-music-event-Steve-Jobs-unveils-touchscreen-iPod-Nano-new-iPod-Touch.html?ito=feeds-newsxml

item.title: New iPod Nano
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“nohope, post:20, topic:358186”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=454692.msg3330698#msg3330698 date=1283453442]

isn’t the back of the iPhone 4 made of glass?

Idiot.

AppleInsider

Glass back of iPhone 4 review unit collects 'incredibly minor' scratches

A review unit sent out by Apple has managed to collect "incredibly minor" scratches on its back made of hardened glass after just a few days of heavy use.


Idiot.
[/quote]
Owned.[/quote]

How so? Could it be he called him an idiot for not already knowing it’s made of glass? Or maybe because he’s just an idiot.

I can understand that when they do something like touchscreens, they always take it to the extreme, and try to sell it home on every device. In this case it doesn’t look right at all, a similar situation to the iPad, the iTouch, even the Apple TV. All of these things at first were received with mixed feelings but now they’ve come to change the way consumers listen to music, browse the internet, even watch tv. I know the technology for some of the things I mentioned was already there, but Apple took the technology in it’s adolescents and made it them the mainstream culture icons they are.

Read full topic

Glass back of iPhone 4 review unit collects 'incredibly minor' scratches

Idiot.[/quote]
Owned.

This new ipod however, what the fuck…

item.title: New iPod Nano
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:12, topic:358186”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=454692.msg3330390#msg3330390 date=1283427738]
I still fail to understand why people think they are visually pleasing. To me they look like pieces of cheap plastic (and feel that way too). Why cant they make one in brushed steel or something like that, a “classy” finish instead of the current white plastic futuristic shit look?
[/quote]
Like an iphone 4 or ipod touch…?

iirc it’s aluminium, but steel is heavy so that would be stupid.[/quote]they both look pretty fucking ugly tbh

That’s the kind of design i like.

Read full topic

item.title: New iPod Nano
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

They don’t look very robust. I have an iPod, generation 5 I believe. Coloured screen but still large etc. At least it seems resilient.
I don’t think it’d take much for one of these to get damaged while sitting in your pocket with something else, such as keys.

Read full topic

item.title: New iPod Nano
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:7, topic:358186”]This just in:

No one cares about flashy, over-priced pieces of crap!!! (ie Apple products)[/quote]

Well, its completely understandable to dislike Apple products. But they sell a fuckton, so to say no one cares about them is a bit silly

Read full topic

item.title: New iPod Nano
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

I have a 2nd generation ipod touch, and I have 0 complaints about it. It has a lovely finish on it, it’s not ‘bricky’, easy to use, so many apps to use with it. Since the day I bought it, there hasn’t been a day where I haven’t used it for something. Although I’ve never used any of the other Apple products before, so I can’t judge them.

@Moparisthebest, £120 for an ipod touch 8GB 2nd generation is not overpriced for what it does/what it is.

Read full topic

item.title: New iPod Nano
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I want my player to fit in my pocket, but I don’t want it the size of a key. I usually have other crap in my pocket aswell, so if I have a tiny player I have to search for it, which probably ends with me janking it out of my pocket by the cord.

Read full topic

item.title: New iPod Nano
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Apple is to launch a new touchscreen version of the iPod nano which is almost half as small as the current version.

The new device is 42 per cent lighter than the existing Nano and no longer has the familiar touchwheel for moving between tracks.

The new device was part of an overhaul of the entire iPod range unveiled by Apple boss Steve Jobs this evening.

Dressed in his traditional uniform of black top and jeans, Jobs said: ‘We’ve gone wild. It’s the biggest change in the iPod lineup ever.’

Read more: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-1308113/Apple-music-event-Steve-Jobs-unveils-touchscreen-iPod-Nano-new-iPod-Touch.html?ito=feeds-newsxml#ixzz0yIlj5rE4

Mail Online – 1 Sep 10

Steve Jobs announces 'wild' updates to iPod range, a social network for music...

Jobs also announced changes to iTunes which included the launch of Ping, a social network for music which lets users share their favourite tracks with friends.

Read full topic
